## A/B Testing Template ğŸ§ª

## Introduction ğŸ“

Welcome to our A/B Testing Template! This is a method used to compare two versions of a webpage or other user experience to determine which one performs better.

---

## Components ğŸ“‹

**Identify Goal** ğŸ¯

*   What is the specific metric that you're trying to improve? This could be click-through rate, conversion rate, time on page, etc.

**Create Variations** ğŸ”„

*   Develop two versions of your webpage or user experience: the control (A) and the variant (B). The variant should include the change you think might improve your goal metric.

**Split Your Audience** ğŸ‘¥

*   Divide your audience into two groups. One group will see the control version, and the other group will see the variant.

**Conduct the Test** ğŸ§ª

*   Run the test for a sufficient amount of time to collect enough data. This could be a few days to a few weeks, depending on your traffic and conversion rates.

**Analyze Results** ğŸ“Š

*   Compare the performance of the control and variant. Which one achieved better results for your goal metric?

---

## Guidelines ğŸ“š

*   **One Variable at a Time** ğŸ§®: Only test one change at a time to ensure that any difference in performance can be attributed to that change.
*   **Statistical Significance** ğŸ“ˆ: Make sure your results are statistically significant before drawing conclusions.
*   **Iterate** ğŸ”: Use the results of each test to inform future tests. Keep iterating and testing to continually improve your user experience.

---
